sections.heading: What is のほうが?
sections.content:
のほうが (no hou ga) is a comparison pattern meaning "more than" or "is more [adjective]." It emphasizes which of two options is better, preferred, or has more of a quality. It literally means "the direction/side of" but functions to mark the preferred option.

こちらのほうが安い "This one is cheaper" 夏のほうが好き "I like summer more" 紅茶のほうがいい "Tea is better"

children.heading: A より B のほうが [adjective]
children.content: 犬より猫のほうが好き "I like cats more than dogs" A = comparison standard (より) B = preferred option (のほうが)

children.heading: Core pattern
children.content: [Standard] より [Preferred] のほうが [Quality] 冬より夏のほうが暑い "Summer is hotter than winter" Emphasizes B over A

children.heading: Expressing preference
children.content: コーヒーより紅茶のほうが好き "I like tea more than coffee" 肉より魚のほうがいい "Fish is better than meat" Clear preference stated

children.heading: Comparing qualities
children.content: 東京より大阪のほうが面白い "Osaka is more interesting than Tokyo" 今日より昨日のほうが寒かった "Yesterday was colder than today" Quality comparison

children.heading: Recommendations
children.content: バスより電車のほうが速い "Trains are faster than buses" これよりそれのほうがいいよ "That one is better than this" Suggesting better option

children.heading: Nominalizes the topic
children.content: こちら + のほうが "This one/side" それ + のほうが "That one" Makes noun phrase

children.heading: Can be omitted with nouns
children.content: Full: 猫のほうが好き Short: 猫がいい Both natural のほうが more emphatic

children.heading: Before the adjective
children.content: 日本語のほうが難しい "Japanese is more difficult" こっちのほうが近い "This way is closer" のほうが marks preferred

children.heading: Works in both
children.content: Casual: これのほうがいいよ "This one is better" Polite: こちらのほうがよろしいです "This one is better" Adjust verb ending

children.heading: A より B のほうが～
children.content: 春より秋のほうが好き "I like fall more than spring" 歩くより走るほうが速い "Running is faster than walking" Most common pattern

children.heading: どちらのほうが (which one)
children.content: どちらのほうが好きですか "Which one do you like more?" どっちのほうがいい？ "Which is better?" Asking for comparison

children.heading: ～のほうがいい
children.content: 早く寝たほうがいい "You should sleep early" やめたほうがいい "You should stop" Advice pattern

children.heading: When context is clear
children.content: Context clear: これのほうが安い "This one is cheaper" Explicit: これはあれより安い "This is cheaper than that" Context determines need

children.heading: Stronger than より alone
children.content: Less emphatic: Aより B "B (than A)" More emphatic: AよりBのほうが "B is more (than A)" のほうが adds emphasis

sections.heading: のほうが vs より

children.heading: より marks standard
children.content: 私より背が高い "Taller than me" Standard of comparison

children.heading: のほうが marks preferred
children.content: 私のほうが背が高い "I am taller" The one who is taller

children.heading: Used together
children.content: 兄より私のほうが背が高い "I am taller than my older brother" Complete comparison Both markers used

children.heading: Shopping/choosing
children.content: こちらのほうが安いです "This one is cheaper" どちらのほうがいいですか "Which one is better?" Making choices

children.heading: Preferences
children.content: 犬より猫のほうが好き "I like cats more than dogs" 映画よりドラマのほうが面白い "Dramas are more interesting than movies" Personal taste

children.heading: Advice
children.content: 休んだほうがいい "You should rest" 行かないほうがいい "You shouldn't go" Suggestions

children.heading: With negative adjectives
children.content: 思ったほど悪くない "Not as bad as I thought" これのほうが難しくない "This one is not as difficult" Less of a quality

children.heading: Advice pattern
children.content: 早く帰ったほうがいい "You should go home early" 医者に行ったほうがいい "You should see a doctor" Recommendation Strong suggestion

children.heading: Past form
children.content: 行ったほうがいい "Should have gone" 言わなかったほうがよかった "Should not have said" Past advice/regret

children.heading: もっと for more emphasis
children.content: こっちのほうがもっと安い "This one is even cheaper" 前よりもっとよくなった "It became even better than before" Extra emphasis

sections.heading: With こちら/そちら/あちら

children.heading: Polite demonstratives
children.content: こちらのほうがよろしいです "This one is better" (polite) そちらのほうがいいと思います "I think that one is better" Formal speech

children.heading: With こっち/そっち/あっち
children.content: こっちのほうがいいよ "This one is better" (casual) あっちのほうが近い "That way is closer" Casual speech

children.heading: ずっと/はるかに + のほうが
children.content: ずっとこちらのほうがいい "This one is much better" はるかに速いほうがいい "Much faster is better" 大幅な違い Significant difference

children.heading: Asking preferences
children.content: どちらのほうが好きですか "Which one do you like more?" どっちのほうがいい？ "Which is better?" Comparison questions

children.heading: Quantity comparisons
children.content: こちらのほうが100円高い "This one is 100 yen more expensive" あれのほうが3センチ長い "That one is 3 cm longer" Specific differences

children.heading: Using が without の
children.content: Wrong: これほうがいい ⚠️ Correct: これのほうがいい ✓ "This one is better" の is required

children.heading: Confusing order
children.content: Wrong: のほうがより ⚠️ Correct: よりのほうが ✓ より comes first

children.heading: Overusing both markers
children.content: Redundant: AよりBのほうがもっと好き ⚠️ Natural: AよりBのほうが好き ✓ Or: Bのほうがずっと好き ✓ Choose appropriate emphasis

children.heading: Standard form
children.content: こっちのほうがいい "This one is better" Universal usage

children.heading: Casual contractions
children.content: こっちがいい "This one is better" のほう dropped in casual speech

children.heading: より〜です/ございます
children.content: こちらのほうがよろしいです "This one is better" (polite) そちらのほうが適しております "That one is more suitable" (formal) Business/formal contexts

children.heading: Comparing more than two
children.content: Use 一番 instead: 一番好きなのは猫です "The one I like most is cats" のほうが is for two items

children.heading: Basic
children.content: こっちのほうが安い "This one is cheaper" 紅茶のほうが好き "I like tea more" 早く帰ったほうがいい "You should go home early"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 電車で行くより、車のほうが便利だと思います "I think going by car is more convenient than by train" 今日より明日のほうが天気がいいらしい "The weather seems to be better tomorrow than today" このレストランよりあのレストランのほうが 人気がある "That restaurant is more popular than this one"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 最初は難しいと思ったが、実際にやってみると 思ったよりずっと簡単だった。本を読むより 実際に試してみるほうが早く理解できる。 理論より実践のほうが大切だと改めて感じた。 "At first I thought it would be difficult, but when I actually tried it, it was much easier than I thought. You can understand faster by actually trying it rather than reading books. I felt anew that practice is more important than theory." 都会で働くより田舎で暮らすほうが ストレスが少ないという人もいるが、 それは人によって違う。自分に合った 環境を見つけることのほうが、 場所そのものよりも重要だと思う。 "Some people say living in the countryside has less stress than working in the city, but that differs by person. I think finding an environment that suits you is more important than the place itself."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: より - Than (comparison marker) 一番 - Most (superlative) ほど - As...as (extent comparison) 同じ - Same (equality) 〜たほうがいい - Should (advice) Comparative adjectives - More/less forms
